result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.   Civil rights suspended until reinstated. Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert D Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING (32 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 6, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Robert D Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Robert D Davis in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3.5 years, concurrent to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1.5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
ORDER TO PRODUCE RECEIVED AND FILED
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Robert D Davis not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert D Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Robert D Davis in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for sentencing on November 2, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

AS TO COUNTS 2-5:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2-5 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Defendant's Witness List - Addendum filed.

Defendant Robert D Davis in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Robert D Davis in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Final pre-trial conference held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on September 28, 2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.
